summary: This is a DOJ OIG interview transcript from June 14, 2021, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional officer lieutenant regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers the lieutenant's duties, shift assignments on August 9-10, 2019, inmate count procedures, rounds, and knowledge of Epstein's cellmate requirement. It reveals potential failures in communication and count accuracy.

persons.name: Marci Bratton
persons.context: Transcriber of the interview, certified the transcript.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at MCC New York; the interview focuses on events surrounding his death.

persons.name: Efren Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was removed from the SHU on August 9, 2019, and not replaced.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Senior staff member working in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019; identified as someone who should have taken initiative.

persons.name: Nova Noel
persons.context: Correctional officer working in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019; mentioned in the context of shift responsibilities.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU before being removed on August 9, 2019.
Both were correctional officers assigned to the SHU on the evening of August 9, 2019, and were responsible for counts and rounds.

events.title: Epstein's last full day in SHU
events.description: Epstein spent the day in attorney conference from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. His cellmate, Efren Reyes, was removed and not replaced. The lieutenant interviewed conducted rounds in the SHU between 5:00 and 8:00 p.m.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the early morning hours, leading to his death.

events.title: Psychology email on cellmate requirement
events.description: Psychology sent an email to lieutenants stating Epstein was required to have a cellmate after coming off suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein's prior suicide attempt
events.description: Epstein had an alleged suicide attempt, after which he was placed on suicide watch/psych observation.

locations: FCI Danbury (training center where interview conducted)
MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center where Epstein was held)
Allenwood, Pennsylvania (BOP assignment prior to MCC)
Agoura Hills, CA (location of Resolute Documentation Services)
keyFacts: The interviewed lieutenant was acting as Activities Lieutenant on August 9, 2019, from 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. and was unaware Epstein was required to have a cellmate.
An email from psychology on July 30, 2019, instructed that Epstein must have a cellmate, but this information was not communicated to the acting lieutenant.
Discrepancies in inmate counts for the SHU on August 9-10 are noted, with counts possibly being falsified or improvised.
The lieutenant stated that if counts and rounds were not conducted, it would be a serious failure, as counting inmates is a primary duty.

The interview reveals a breakdown in the chain of command regarding the communication of Epstein's cellmate requirement, with the operations lieutenant identified as key in disseminating such information.
